trans-unit.source: Maps specific adapters to specific mobile controls for a given device.
This class cannot be inherited.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This class represents a `device` element in an XML configuration file.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceElement"></xref> class with the specified identifier and device adapter set to inherit from.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The unique identifier of the device adapter set.
The device adapter set that this device adapter set inherits from.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceElement"></xref> class with the specified identifier and page adapter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The unique identifier of the device adapter set.
The class to which the method specified by predicateMethod belongs.
A method used to detect through the current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> whether the device adapter set is applicable.
Identifies the page adapter class for the device set.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceElement"></xref> class with the specified identifier, page adapter, and device adapter set to inherit from.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The unique identifier of the device adapter set.
The device adapter set that this device adapter set inherits from.
The class to which the method specified by predicateMethod belongs.
A method used to detect through the current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> whether the device adapter set is applicable.
Identifies the page adapter class for the device set.
Gets the collection of control elements for this device element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The collection of control elements for this device element.
Gets or sets the name of the device adapter set that this device adapter set inherits from.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The name of the device adapter set that this device adapter set inherits from.
Gets the string value that uniquely identifies the device adapter set.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The string value that uniquely identifies the device adapter set.
Gets the type of the page adapter class for this device adapter set.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The type of the page adapter class for this device adapter set.
Gets or sets the class containing the method used to detect whether the device adapter set is applicable.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The class to which the method specified by the predicateMethod parameter belongs.
Gets or sets the method used to detect through the current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> instance whether the device adapter set is applicable.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The method used to detect through the current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> whether the device adapter set is applicable.
